Walton |known_for = [[Nanotechnology]], [[Self assembly]], Complex Materials |awards = [[Philip Leverhulme Prize]] }} '''Leroy (Lee) Cronin''' (born June 1, 1973) http://www.chem.gla.ac.uk/cronin/biography.php Cronin CV is the Gardiner Professor Chemistry in the Department Chemistry at the [[University of Glasgow]], UK.{{cite web|title=Prof Leroy Cronin|url=http://www.gla.ac.uk/stafflist/?action=person&id=4fdceee18a90203c98f3|publisher=[[University of Glasgow]]|accessdate=20 February 2011}} http://www.gla.ac.uk:443/newsreview/story.cfm?id=215 University of Glasgow News Review: Tiny molecule is 10,000 times thinner than a single hair http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/scotland/4573117.stm Chips squeezed by nanoscale work He was elected to the Fellowship of the [[Royal Society of Edinburgh]], the [[Royal Society of Chemistry]], and appointed to the Gardiner Chair in April 2009. ==Biography== Lee Cronin received his [[Bachelor of Science|B.Sc.]] (1994) and [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D.]] (1997) degrees from the [[University of York]]. From 1997 to 1999, he was a [[Leverhulme]] fellow at the [[University of Edinburgh]] working with Dr Neil Robertson, and after that he moved to the [[University of Bielefeld]] (1999â2000) as an [[Alexander_von_Humboldt_Foundation|Alexander von Humboldt]] research fellow in the laboratory of Professor [[Achim Mueller]]. In 2000 he joined the academic staff at the [[University of Birmingham]], UK, as a Lecturer in Chemistry, and in 2002 he moved to a similar position at the University of Glasgow, UK. He became Reader at the [[University of Glasgow]] in 2005, EPSRC Advanced Fellow and Professor of Chemistry at that institution in 2006, and in 2009 became the Gardiner Professor there. Cronin gave the opening lecture at [[TEDGlobal]] conference in 2011 in Edinburgh. http://www.ted.com/talks/lee_cronin_making_matter_come_alive.html He outlined initial steps his team at University of Glasgow is taking to create [[inorganic biology]], life composed of non-carbon-based material. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.chem.gla.ac.uk/Cronin(Lee) Cronin.
